poem:
"News As A Red Wheelbarrow"

As impartiality splinters,
much depends on GB News,
glazed red with bias,
beside the white Tory MPs.

From the shadows cast, 
Stewart Purvis breathes unease,
Adam Boulton sketches whispers.
Their voices subdued by the blatant Farage. 

Trepidation tinted, the news takes flight,
Roosting in minds painted in monochrome,
An emblem of tarnished broadcasting blight.
